column4: hello, I am trying to modify my partitions and can't figure out how to move my linux partition. Current layout is 205GiB unallocated, then a 25 GiB extended partition with the EXT and swap in it. How can I move the OS to the beginning of the drive? (remnant of when Windows was at the beginning)
why does it matter where it is?
The beginning of a HDD is faster due to the rotation and physics of a cylindrical disc
In theory: yes, noticable in daily use: no. But if you have to move it, use a gparted livecd
